trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure AD Connect that describes what it is and why you would use it.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure AD Connect that describes what it is and why you would use it.

trans-unit.source: Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect is the tool to integrate your on-premises identity system such as Windows Server Active Directory with Azure Active Directory and connect your users to Office 365, Azure and 1000’s of SaaS applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect is the tool to integrate your on-premises identity system such as Windows Server Active Directory with Azure Active Directory and connect your users to Office 365, Azure and 1000’s of SaaS applications.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides a comprehensive guide to prepare and deploy the necessary components for your end users to access cloud services with the same identity that they use today to access existing company apps.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides a comprehensive guide to prepare and deploy the necessary components for your end users to access cloud services with the same identity that they use today to access existing company apps.

trans-unit.source: What is Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: What is Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Why use Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Why use Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Integrating your on-premises directories with Azure AD makes your users more productive by providing a common identity for accessing both cloud and on-premises resources.
trans-unit.target: Integrating your on-premises directories with Azure AD makes your users more productive by providing a common identity for accessing both cloud and on-premises resources.

trans-unit.source: With this integration users and organizations can take advantage of the following:
trans-unit.target: With this integration users and organizations can take advantage of the following:

trans-unit.source: Users can use a single identity to access on-premises applications and cloud services such as Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Users can use a single identity to access on-premises applications and cloud services such as Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Single tool to provide an easy deployment experience for synchronization and sign-in.
trans-unit.target: Single tool to provide an easy deployment experience for synchronization and sign-in.

trans-unit.source: Provides the newest capabilities for your scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Provides the newest capabilities for your scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect replaces older versions of identity integration tools such as DirSync and Azure AD Sync.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect replaces older versions of identity integration tools such as DirSync and Azure AD Sync.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Directory integration tools comparison](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-tools-comparison.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Directory integration tools comparison](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-tools-comparison.md).

trans-unit.source: How Azure AD Connect works
trans-unit.target: How Azure AD Connect works

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Connect is made up of three primary parts.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Connect is made up of three primary parts.

trans-unit.source: They are the synchronization services, the optional Active Directory Federation Services piece, and the monitoring piece which is done using [Azure AD Connect Health](active-directory-aadconnect-health.md).
trans-unit.target: They are the synchronization services, the optional Active Directory Federation Services piece, and the monitoring piece which is done using [Azure AD Connect Health](active-directory-aadconnect-health.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect Stack
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect Stack

trans-unit.source: Synchronization - This part is made up of the components and functionality previously released as [Dirsync and Azure AD Sync](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-tools-comparison.md).
trans-unit.target: Synchronization - This part is made up of the components and functionality previously released as [Dirsync and Azure AD Sync](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-tools-comparison.md).

trans-unit.source: This is the part that is responsible for creating users and groups.
trans-unit.target: This is the part that is responsible for creating users and groups.

trans-unit.source: It is also responsible for making sure that the information on users and groups in your on-premises environment, matches the cloud.
trans-unit.target: It is also responsible for making sure that the information on users and groups in your on-premises environment, matches the cloud.

trans-unit.source: AD FS - This is an optional part of Azure AD Connect and can be used to setup a hybrid environment using an on-premises AD FS infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: AD FS - This is an optional part of Azure AD Connect and can be used to setup a hybrid environment using an on-premises AD FS infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: This part can be used by organizations to address complex deployments that include such things as domain join SSO, enforcement of AD login policy and smart card or 3rd party MFA.
trans-unit.target: This part can be used by organizations to address complex deployments that include such things as domain join SSO, enforcement of AD login policy and smart card or 3rd party MFA.

trans-unit.source: Health Monitoring - Azure AD Connect Health can provide robust monitoring of your AD FS servers and provide a central location in the Azure portal to view this activity.
trans-unit.target: Health Monitoring - Azure AD Connect Health can provide robust monitoring of your AD FS servers and provide a central location in the Azure portal to view this activity.

trans-unit.source: For additional information see [Azure Active Directory Connect Health](active-directory-aadconnect-health.md).
trans-unit.target: For additional information see [Azure Active Directory Connect Health](active-directory-aadconnect-health.md).

trans-unit.source: Install Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Install Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: You can find the download for Azure AD Connect on [Microsoft Download Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615771).
trans-unit.target: You can find the download for Azure AD Connect on [Microsoft Download Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615771).

trans-unit.target: Express settings

trans-unit.source: Recommended and default option if you have a single forest AD.
trans-unit.target: Recommended and default option if you have a single forest AD.

trans-unit.source: User sign in with the same password using password synchronization.
trans-unit.target: User sign in with the same password using password synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Customized settings
trans-unit.target: Customized settings

trans-unit.source: Used when you have multiple forests.
trans-unit.target: Used when you have multiple forests.

trans-unit.source: Supports many on-premises [topologies](active-directory-aadconnect-topologies.md).
trans-unit.target: Supports many on-premises [topologies](active-directory-aadconnect-topologies.md).

trans-unit.source: Customize your sign-in option , such as ADFS for federation or use a 3rd party identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Customize your sign-in option , such as ADFS for federation or use a 3rd party identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Customize synchronization features, such as filtering and writeback.
trans-unit.target: Customize synchronization features, such as filtering and writeback.

trans-unit.target: Upgrade from DirSync

trans-unit.target: If you have an existing DirSync server already running.

trans-unit.target: Upgrade from Azure AD Sync

trans-unit.source: This is a seamless in-place upgrade.
trans-unit.target: This is a seamless in-place upgrade.

trans-unit.target: [After installation](active-directory-aadconnect-whats-next.md) you should verify it is working as expected and assign licenses to the users.

trans-unit.source: You also want to prepare for [operational](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md) concerns.
trans-unit.target: You also want to prepare for [operational](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md) concerns.

trans-unit.source: You might want to have a stand-by server so you easily can fall over in case of a [disaster](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#disaster-recovery).
trans-unit.target: You might want to have a stand-by server so you easily can fall over in case of a [disaster](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#disaster-recovery).

trans-unit.source: If you plan to make frequent configuration changes you should plan for a [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) server.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to make frequent configuration changes you should plan for a [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) server.

trans-unit.source: Configure features
trans-unit.target: Configure features

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect comes with several features you can optionally turn on or are enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect comes with several features you can optionally turn on or are enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Some features might in some cases require additional configuration in certain scenarios and topologies.
trans-unit.target: Some features might in some cases require additional configuration in certain scenarios and topologies.

trans-unit.source: [Filtering](active-directory-aadconnectsync-configure-filtering.md) is used when you want to limit which objects are synchronized to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Filtering](active-directory-aadconnectsync-configure-filtering.md) is used when you want to limit which objects are synchronized to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: By default all users, contacts, groups, and Windows 10 computers are synchronized, but you can limit this based on domains, OUs, or attributes.
trans-unit.target: By default all users, contacts, groups, and Windows 10 computers are synchronized, but you can limit this based on domains, OUs, or attributes.

trans-unit.source: [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md) will synchronize the password hash in Active Directory to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Password synchronization](active-directory-aadconnectsync-implement-password-synchronization.md) will synchronize the password hash in Active Directory to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: This allows the user to use the same password on-premises and in the cloud but only manage it in one location.
trans-unit.target: This allows the user to use the same password on-premises and in the cloud but only manage it in one location.

trans-unit.source: Since it will use your on-premises Active Directory it will also allow you to use your own password policy.
trans-unit.target: Since it will use your on-premises Active Directory it will also allow you to use your own password policy.

trans-unit.source: [Password writeback](active-directory-passwords-getting-started.md) will allow your users to change and reset their passwords in the cloud and have your on-premises password policy applied.
trans-unit.target: [Password writeback](active-directory-passwords-getting-started.md) will allow your users to change and reset their passwords in the cloud and have your on-premises password policy applied.

trans-unit.source: [Device writeback](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-custom-device-writeback.md) will allow a device registered in Azure AD to be written back to on-premises Active Directory so it can be used for conditional access.
trans-unit.target: [Device writeback](active-directory-aadconnect-get-started-custom-device-writeback.md) will allow a device registered in Azure AD to be written back to on-premises Active Directory so it can be used for conditional access.

trans-unit.source: The [prevent accidental deletes](active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-prevent-accidental-deletes.md) feature is turned on by default and will protect your cloud directory from a lot of deletes at the same time.
trans-unit.target: The [prevent accidental deletes](active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-prevent-accidental-deletes.md) feature is turned on by default and will protect your cloud directory from a lot of deletes at the same time.

trans-unit.source: By default it will allow 500 deletes per run and this can be changed depending on your organization’s size.
trans-unit.target: By default it will allow 500 deletes per run and this can be changed depending on your organization’s size.

trans-unit.source: Customize Azure AD Connect sync
trans-unit.target: Customize Azure AD Connect sync

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync comes with a default configuration which is intended to work for most customers and topologies.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync comes with a default configuration which is intended to work for most customers and topologies.

trans-unit.source: But there are always situations where the default configuration will not work and must be adjusted.
trans-unit.target: But there are always situations where the default configuration will not work and must be adjusted.

trans-unit.source: It is supported to make changes as documented in this section and linked topics.
trans-unit.target: It is supported to make changes as documented in this section and linked topics.

trans-unit.source: If you have not worked with a synchronization topology before you want to start to understand the basics and the terms used as described in the [technical concepts](active-directory-aadconnectsync-technical-concepts.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have not worked with a synchronization topology before you want to start to understand the basics and the terms used as described in the [technical concepts](active-directory-aadconnectsync-technical-concepts.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect is the evolution of MIIS2003, ILM2007, and FIM2010.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect is the evolution of MIIS2003, ILM2007, and FIM2010.

trans-unit.source: Even if some things are identical, a lot has changed as well.
trans-unit.target: Even if some things are identical, a lot has changed as well.

trans-unit.source: The [default configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-default-configuration.md) assumes there might be more than one forest in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: The [default configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-default-configuration.md) assumes there might be more than one forest in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: In those topologies a user object might be represented as a contact in another forest.
trans-unit.target: In those topologies a user object might be represented as a contact in another forest.

trans-unit.source: The user might also have a linked mailbox in another resource forest.
trans-unit.target: The user might also have a linked mailbox in another resource forest.

trans-unit.source: The behavior of the default configuration is described in [users and contacts](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-users-and-contacts.md).
trans-unit.target: The behavior of the default configuration is described in [users and contacts](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-users-and-contacts.md).

trans-unit.source: The configuration model in sync is called [declarative provisioning](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-declarative-provisioning-expressions.md).
trans-unit.target: The configuration model in sync is called [declarative provisioning](active-directory-aadconnectsync-understanding-declarative-provisioning-expressions.md).

trans-unit.source: The advanced attribute flows are using [functions](active-directory-aadconnectsync-functions-reference.md) to express attribute transformations.
trans-unit.target: The advanced attribute flows are using [functions](active-directory-aadconnectsync-functions-reference.md) to express attribute transformations.

trans-unit.source: You can see and examine the entire configuration using tools which comes with Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: You can see and examine the entire configuration using tools which comes with Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you need to make changes to the configuration, make sure you follow the [best practices](active-directory-aadconnectsync-best-practices-changing-default-configuration.md) so it will be easier to adopt new releases as these are made available.
trans-unit.target: If you need to make changes to the configuration, make sure you follow the [best practices](active-directory-aadconnectsync-best-practices-changing-default-configuration.md) so it will be easier to adopt new releases as these are made available.
